content:
Other ACLs efforts

  • LDAP

  • IMAP: rfc2086

    • lookup, read, write, insert, post, create, delete, administer, keep seen/unseen info across sessions
    • Rights apply only to mailboxes

  • CAP (Calendar Access Protocol)

  • CAT

Previous slide Next slide Back to first slide View graphic version

Notes:

    Paul Leach observed at IETF-LA LDAP that if DAV and LDAP aim at the same space, there needs to be isomorphic security. In LDAP, there's sensitivity levels: a record could be marked confidential or private. This seems restricitive because it lumps together lots and lots of records at the same level.
